column4: any experienced UBUNTU users in here who also have extensive experience with GENTOO
i have a question
i am an experienced gentoo user, (both server and desktop) but am fed up with gentoo not working on my laptop
my only questinon would be about the ubuntu package management sistem. i LOVE gentoo's and wound like to know if ubuntu's is as good
there is nothing better than #emerge -s gnome
or what ever, it spits out tons of packages, and i just  look for the right one, and bam
so to search for a package i just use that command?
yes, that searches descriptions and names
cool, and i assume that there are ~ number of packages for ubuntu as well
ubuntu repositories have around 16000 packages altogether or so
very good then, that does it, thanks guys for your hlep!
for a few 3rd-party proprietary packs (javadebs, etc) see /msg ubotu seveas
sounds good
sun-java debs, that is.
ok, thanks
http://ubuntu.wordpress.com/2005/12/04/libdvdcss2-and-w32codecs-for-ubuntu/
first it's really best to see the wiki entry on adding repositories and/or what ones you'll want. /msg ubotu repositories
to see the methodology behind the split main/restricted/universe/multiverse main repositories, see /msg ubotu components
